result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Luis A Vera Casas

records.addlTxt: Plea/sentencing hearing on December 1, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

10:46 AM; Case called for Plea/sentencing hearing.  Defendant Luis A Vera Casas in court.  Attorney Aaron R Anderson in court for Luis A Vera Casas.  Prosecuting attorney Randy P. Sitzberger in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty. Anderson provides an update; his client needs just a little more time to get his license reinstated to take advantage of the offer.  Atty. Anderson requests a new plea and sentencing date very soon.  No objection by the State.  Court adjourns for plea and sentencing in about 30-45 days to be sure the matter will be ready to proceed.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 1, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 26, 2022 at 10:30 am.

11:07 AM; Case called for Plea/sentencing hearing.  Prosecuting attorney Christian Farina in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Luis A Vera Casas in court.  Attorney Aaron R Anderson in court for Luis A Vera Casas. Atty. Anderson provides an update, his client needs additional time to get his driver's license reinstated.  Atty. Anderson requests a new plea and sentencing date in October.  No objection by the State.  Court adjourns for plea and sentencing.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 26, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 18, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Motion to Adjourn filed by Atty. Anderson.   **Reviewed by the Court 8/3/22 - Request/Motion granted.**
Effective August 1, 2022, this case is assigned to Branch 7 Judicial Vacancy, pursuant to 22-SO-04(67).
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 5, 2022 at 10:00 am.

11:13 AM; Case called for Hearing.  Defendant Luis A Vera Casas in court with attorney Aaron R Anderson.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Abigail Kincheloe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty. Anderson has an offer and is requesting a plea and sentencing date early August.  Court adjourns for plea and sentencing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 5, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Hearing on June 13, 2022 at 10:30 am.

records.addlTxt: 01:04 PM Defendant Luis A Vera Casas in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Katrina Voge appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The State has no objection to reinstating bail.  The defendant makes statements as to his non-appearance.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  The defendant is provided with a Petition for Court Appointed Counsel.  Court takes a recess at 1:07 PM.  Matter recalled at 1:48 PM with the same appearances.  Defendant requests the court appoint counsel.  Court swears defendant.  Court denies request.  The Court will set this matter back for status of counsel.  Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.  Hearing scheduled for April 28, 2022 at 10:00 am.

EXT CODE 2
Milwaukee County Case No. 21CF2925

11:33 AM Defendant Luis A Vera Casas not in court.  Andrew Nesheim appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State motions the Court to issue a warrant for the defendant and to revoke and forfeit any bail.
Hearing on March 31, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.  Comply with all licensing restrictions.

03:11 PM Defendant Luis A Vera Casas in court, in custody, with attorney Luis Daniel Gutierrez.   Attorney appears as friend of the court.  Christian Farina appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is not eligible for State Public Defender representation.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.  Hearing scheduled for March 31, 2022 at 10:00 am.
